synonyms.value: Toxic polyneuropathy; Peripheral neuropathy induced by occupational toxin;

comments.value: Most symmetrical, sensorimotor neuropathies caused by exposure to chemicals are indistinguishable from similar effects caused by systemic diseases such as alcoholism, diabetes mellitus, uremia, or B12 deficiency. The diagnosis of toxic polyneuropathy is usually made on the basis of symptoms following exposure to the chemical and the resolution of symptoms months to years after cessation of exposure. [LaDou, p. 428] Chemicals that Can Cause Toxic Polyneuropathy: C: Carbon disulfide; L: Lead; A: Arsenic, Acrylamide; M: Mercury; N: N-hexane; O: Organophosphate insecticides; T: Thallium; E: Ethylene oxide; Some organophosphate insecticides can Induce Delayed Neuropathy (OPIDN). OPIDN usually occurs after ingestion, and is usually nonoccupational. [Levy, p. 431] Lead, n-hexane, and organophosphates tend to cause predominantly motor neuropathy, while the other agents produce sensorimotor neuropathy. [Rom, p. 640-55]

diagnostic.value: History; Neurological examination; EMG and nerve conduction test

symptomsfindings.value: Symptoms/Findings associated with this disease: neuropathy paresthesia weakness

job_tasks.value: High risk job tasks associated with this disease: Apply arsenic preservatives to wood Cut and dry rayon filaments Extract mercury ore (cinnabar) Fabricate measuring devices containing mercury Heat, machine, or spray lead products Manufacture arsenical pesticides Manufacture lead products Manufacture or use mercury dental amalgams Mix or apply organophosphates or work in fields after an application Reclaim scrap metal containing lead, cadmium, beryllium, or mercury Remove lead coatings Saw or sand arsenic-treated wood Smelt or cast lead Smelt or refine zinc or copper Sterilize equipment with ethylene oxide Use acrylamide for grouting (sewers, mining, and tunnel construction) Use carbon disulfide as fumigant Use mercury to extract gold Use n-hexane as a solvent in glues, inks, coatings, or degreasers Work in the mercury cell room in a chloralkali plant Work with toxic chemicals that could be spilled or released
